description: From French morose, from Latin mōrōsus (“particular, scrupulous, fastidious, self-willed, wayward, capricious, fretful, peevish”), from mōs (“way, custom, habit, self-will”). See moral.

adjectives.description: morose (comparative more morose or moroser, superlative most morose or morosest)

entries.meaning: Sullen, gloomy; showing a brooding ill humour.
examples: Synonyms: melancholy, sulky, crabby, glum, grouchy, gruff, moody
